message: You are one of the first 20 buyers, and I'm offering you a high-quality product for $1000000. This is a unique opportunity to be one of the first to experience the best of what I have to offer. Don't miss out on this chance to own a premium product at a price that reflects its value.

I'd be happy to explain the discrepancy. The observed proportion of high-quality products sold being 100% is indeed higher than the expected probability of 80%. However, it's essential to consider the concept of the 'gambler's fallacy.' Just because the last few products sold were high-quality, it doesn't mean that the next product will be low-quality.
